message.content:
cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SI, cs.SP, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with source coding, which is a subfield of information theory (cs.IT). It also involves quantization and sampling, which are common topics in multimedia (cs.MM) and signal processing (cs.SP). The use of multiple descriptions and random binning suggests a focus on redundancy and error resilience, which are relevant to both information theory and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper proposes a coding scheme that combines different techniques, which could fall under the category of systems and control (cs.SI).
